intro: Senecio gilliesii, commonly known as the Gillies' groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are usually yellow or white, blooming from spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in its native environment. Senecio gilliesii is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar composite flower structures.
